alert.note: Alert for Gila (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 13 at 6:57PM MST until August 13 at 8:15PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR EASTERN GILA COUNTY... At 655 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain in eastern Gila County. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain fell earlier this evening. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Cedar Creek, Fort Apache Reservation, Canyon Day. This includes the following highways... Highway 60 between mile markers 298 and 308. State Route 73 between mile markers 320 and 334. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Get out of washes and creeks if you are camping or hiking! Flooding is occurring or imminent and will inundate area drainages.
